summary: This is a service request form for technical support related to the installation of a Nice Vision system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held. The document shows IT personnel working on a system installation issue.

persons.name: Jeff Cram
persons.context: Listed as assigned to the service request for installing a Nice Vision system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Assigned to work on the Nice Vision system installation issue at the correctional facility.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Assigned to the service request for technical installation support at the correctional center.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Mentioned in assignment comments for the service request.

connections.description: Both assigned to the same service request for technical installation at the correctional facility.
Both working on the same technical service request for system installation.

events.title: Nice Vision system installation service request
events.description: Service request created for installation of a Nice Vision system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, with technical errors encountered during installation.

keyFacts: This document is a service request form dated September 24, 2019 for technical support at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The request involves installation of a 'Nice Vision system' which appears to be a surveillance or monitoring system.
The location (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) is the address of the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The document shows IT personnel (Jeff Cram, Jeff McKenzie, Justin Houston, Jeff Cranor) working on technical installation issues.
The timing (September 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019 while in custody at this facility.
